author: Jonathan Castro
title: Aborto en CDMX: En 17 años ninguna mujer ha muerto, afirma la Sedesa
text: La titular de la Secretaría de Salud (Sedesa), Nadine Gasman Zylbermann, afirmó que en los 17 años que tiene la Interrupción Legal del Embarazo en la Ciudad de México se han hecho 277 mil procedimientos de este tipo y ninguna mujer ha fallecido. Contrario a lo que ha afirmado la[ Iglesia ](https://www.razon.com.mx/ciudad/2024/11/07/pide-iglesia-protestar-en-contra-del-aborto/)en los recientes días al afirmar que el aborto es inseguro, la funcionaria capitalina aclaró en conferencia que este procedimiento no pone en riesgo a la mujer. “Lo que nos demuestra la experiencia de la Ciudad de México, que ahora tenemos en otros estados del país, es que es un procedimiento seguro en todos los estándares." Seguridad Con mazos, intentan robar joyería en la plaza Portal San Ángel; buscan a 2 sujetos “Una de las cosas que es importante decir es que esto es un derecho y es un tema de salud pública, tenemos que ponerlo en ese contexto y también pensar que lo que se está planteando no es promover el aborto, sino sacarlo del Código Penal y ponerlo en el ámbito de salud. No queremos que ninguna mujer sea criminalizada ni vaya a prisión por ejercer sus derechos sexuales y reproductivos”, aclaró. Gasman Zylbermann aclaró también que cerca de 90 por ciento de los abortos que se han llevado a cabo en la capital ocurrió antes de las 12 semanas de gestación y la mayoría de los que ocurrieron fuera de ese lapso fue por el riesgo de la madre. La secretaria de Salud manifestó su respaldo a la iniciativa de la diputada local de Morena, Yuriri Ayala Zúñiga, para [quitar del Código Penal de la ciudad el delito de aborto](https://www.razon.com.mx/ciudad/2024/11/07/despenalizacion-del-aborto-en-cdmx-chocan-feministas-y-provida/). La propuesta ya fue aprobada en comisiones y se espera su discusión en el Pleno del Congreso de la Ciudad de México. “Despenalizar el aborto es una recomendación de la OMS, porque la penalización no previene que las mujeres busquen hacerse un aborto y sí las pueden poner en riesgo. Sacarlo del Código Penal y Reglamentarlo y tener lineamientos de salud es a lo que tenemos que aspirar. “No se pone en riesgo la salud de la mujer, lo que pone en riesgo la salud de la mujer es no tener acceso a servicios de calidad, a tener servicios profesionales para hacer los procedimientos”, mencionó la funcionaria. Si bien la Iglesia ha afirmado que la despenalización de la interrupción del embarazo generará “un mercado de abortos”, datos de la Sedesa muestran que en los últimos seis años, la práctica de este procedimiento ha disminuido más de 20 por ciento. [Únete a nuestro canal de WhatsApp.](https://www.whatsapp.com/channel/0029Va4honc30LKY9Z0wAT1u) En La Razón enviamos a tu celular lo más importante México y el Mundo, recuerda que una persona informada siempre tiene La Razón. LMCT

author: Mimaus
title: #75 Fe, familia y odio al progresismo: el poder de los evangélicos latinos se extiende por Estados Unidos
text:
Portada
mis comunidades
otras secciones
[#4](c4#c-4) Es una manera de verlo. Otra es que unos cuantos españoles se han marchado a países menos corruptos, han visto que se vive mejor así y evitan votar a los partidos que mantienen aquí niveles indecentes de corrupción.
Pero hay de todo…
[#4](c4#c-4) te recomiendo algo más de fibra en tu dieta, parece que aún no has digerido el que no ganaran los tuyos
[#4](c4#c-4) que yo conozca la gente que emigra a EEUU normalmente son gente con títulos superiores donde irse a América es muy buena opción laboral, y ya esta, si votan a la izquierda española sera porque ven desde fuera que es mejor opción.
Que pasa con los que votan a la derecha?
Que significaria?
Por cierto a mayor nivel de estudios el votante de izquierda aumenta, tampoco dices nada de eso?
[#37](c37#c-37) Ay pobres comunistas que el problema que tienen es que son dependientes de importar todo de EEUU.
Pues que sepas que la mayoría del pollo en Cuba viene de Miami, el embargo está hoy en día muy limitado.
Ah, y en la guerra fría había más gente en el bloque comunista que en el bloque capitalista.. y aun así al bloque capitalista le iba mil veces mejor y no necesitaban para nada a los comunistas.
[#1](c1#c-1) No veo relación entre el fanatismo religioso cristiano y los problemas político sociales en latinoamérica.
El Salvador es de los países más evangélicos, junto a Brasil, y las cosas les han empezado a ir bien.
Argentina y Venezuela no son países de corte religioso evangélico y están comiendo mierda.
En Cuba ni religiosos son, y no tienen ni para comer mierda.
[#33](c33#c-33) derecha y diosito van siempre juntitos, si te convenzo que estás en la tierra para sufrir a cambio de una recompensa cuando te mueras, aguantas mejor que te pisen, porque a mayor sufrimiento mayor recompensa
[#33](c33#c-33) Simple, estos tipos se oponen al planamiento familiar.
https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4449999/
[#33](c33#c-33) es como con el islam, no hay relación entre el fanatismo religioso de los países y su nivel de desarrollo democrático o económico...
[#1](c1#c-1) por no hablar de que sus antepasados se arrancarían los pelos de desesperación por ver como han abrazado la religión que los masacró
[#1](c1#c-1) con la diferencia de que cuando vienen para acá muchos de ellos se vuelven muy de derechas besando los pies de sus verdugos.. los cuales por delante les dicen, con papeles inmigrante bueno, y por detrás le dicen a los españoles, mirad, estos son los que os roban el trabajo y las paguitas..
Y los testigos de Jehová. Antes estaban a la salida de los hospitales con sus plafones. Ahora los veo en: la salida del metro, de los parques y en cualquier esquina o paseo. De 3 en 3. Si no les miras no te molestan, al menos en mi experiencia, pero me parece preocupante cómo van invadiendo el espacio público para su negocio de proselitismo religioso. ¿Puedo plantar un plafón con folletos de mi empresa 7 u 8 horas allá dónde me apetezca y abordar a los transeúntes?
[#3](c3#c-3) al igual que llevan toda la vida ocupando espacio publico los mendigos, los que reparten folletos, los grupos de turistas guiados.... mientras la ocupacion no sea permanente, no hay problema
[#3](c3#c-3) En mi pequeña ciudad de 40k habitantes el otro día me crucé a cuatro así, todos eran latinos. Les dije con palabras poco amables que se fueran con sus historias a su templo, que la calle no era lugar para ello. Eran muy ridículos, hablaban con una grandiosidad típica de pastor evangélico y que si la gloria de dios y mierdas así. Llamé a la policía. Me parece sumamente preocupante esto. Uno de ellos aún venía con ese falso buen rollo a "debatir" conmigo y me hacía preguntas de lo más ridículas. Largo de la calle por favor.
[#21](c21#c-21) y que pasó cuando llamaste a la policía? Que te dijeron los guardias? conseguiste que se fueran?
[#42](c42#c-42) Se fueron a la hora aproximadamente, pero no sé si por su propio pie o por la policía, ya que yo volví donde ellos media hora larga después y ahí seguían. La poli dijo que iba a mandar una patrulla y vi un coche una hora después de llamarles, pero capaz que iban a otro sitio, así que no puedo confirmar. Me olía que estos predicadores eran evangélicos pagados por alguien de aquí o de allá para hacer la ruta, porque el brasileño tenía un acento increíble y hablaba español justo.
[#3](c3#c-3) pero esos, "por fortuna", son tan radicales que no van a ser mayoría nunca y hasta la fecha no se meten en política. Por lo demás, totalmente de acuerdo.
[#3](c3#c-3) En mi bloque ahora dejan cartas en los buzones diciendo que te van a solucionar la vida y te dejan su WhatsApp y una dirección para que vayas a sus reuniones. Se aprovechan de gente ignorante y desesperada. Menuda secta.
Yo lo llamaría "fe seudocristiana", porque muchas veces esto no está movido por una fe religiosa, sino que la fe religiosa es solo el medio para mover otra cosa, por ejemplo, mantener a la gente distraída odiando el aborto o a los homosexuales mientras no se dan cuenta de que otros se están quedando con la mayor parte de su esfuerzo al trabajar.
Lo peor es que muchos de esos nuevos templos se construyen en base a la necesidad de las gentes que acuden a ellos, aportan "lo que no tienen" y cuatro vividores y sus comparsas se hacen de oro. Para colmo, les adoctrinan con ideología neoliberal envuelta en el evangelio de "san saduceo" , que les promete la "prosperidad", sobre todo la material, demonizando todo sentido crítico que les haga pensar que ese sistema económico es el que les mantiene en la servidumbre y la desigualdad y del que muy pocos saldrán , que siempre son los que les piden el diezmo y lo que haga falta "para el culto", que no es otro que el que zarandea un libro con dorso dorado y una cruz desde el atril...
Esa gente es muy peligrosa, ya que al contrario que otras sectas, quieren acaparan todas las instancias del estado. Su avaricia no tiene límites, son capaces de vender a su madre por cuatro duros.
La religión era prácticamente la única cosa de LATAM que EEUU no controlaba, pero con el evangelismo es probable que en una década o dos reemplace al catolicismo en cantidad de seguidores.
Las personas más insoportables del mundo son los conversos en cualquier modo. Religión, pelo blanco, deporte, vegetariano..., debe ser como ves que tu vida es una mierda y te has equivocado quieres imponer a los demás tu vida de p... Mierda

author: mr.han
title: 风味西城 | 有滋有味 京味密码
text:
超三千年的建城史，八百七十余载建都岁月，北京既有深厚的人文底色，又是潮流的国际都市，恢宏而不失细腻，厚重而兼具轻灵，值得你我细细端详，深度奔赴。
游玩北京，寻味西城。“有剧有展有美食”，西城的“有滋有味”，是文化的传承，也是历史的沉淀。西城美食更是一绝，是多少人镌刻在记忆深处的京味密码。
全聚德（和平门店）
一炉百年火，铸就全聚德。全聚德始建于1864年（清朝同治三年），是中华老字号烤鸭的代表品牌。传承宫廷挂炉烤鸭技艺161年，从当年御厨孙师傅的单杆相传，到今天的发展壮大，经历了七代烤鸭师的坚守与传承，铸就了“全聚德”百年金字招牌。
全聚德烤鸭的烤制工序环环相扣，30余道工序延续百年，道道有学问、有讲究，出炉后的烤鸭香而不腻，回味无穷。
其和平门店作为旗舰店，自1979年开业以来，以“挂炉烤鸭”技艺闻名中外。烤鸭外观饱满，颜色呈枣红色，油淋光亮，味道鲜美，香而不腻，配以荷叶饼、葱、酱食之，腴美醇厚，回味不尽，是体验京味餐饮的首选之地。
经过不断创新，从单一的烤鸭售卖，发展成为以挂炉烤鸭为龙头，集各大菜系之所长、取材讲究、烹饪技艺独特的京鲁菜代表之一。
全聚德博物馆位于全聚德和平门店七层，面积 1000平方米，生动细致地讲述了全聚德的发展故事。馆内有处蜡像，正是梅兰芳陪同老舍请巴金先生吃烤鸭的形象。
6月，全聚德和平门店五层全新打造的“中华一绝·空中四合院”文化餐饮新空间正式迎宾。该门店以国家级非遗美食为核心，首次将传统四合院“院落-宅邸”的建筑格局搬至城市高空，营造出独特的“云端四合院”意境，打造出沉浸式的京城文化体验，既是对传统文脉的致敬，也为非遗传承注入了新的活力。
门店信息
电话：010-83193100，010-83193101
地址：前门西大街14号
老舍茶馆（前门总店）
北京老舍茶馆始建于1988年，其前身可追溯到1979年的前门大碗茶。老舍茶馆以“振兴古国茶文化，扶植民族艺术花”为经营宗旨，现营业面积4300平方米，包含茶、戏、餐、礼四大经营业态，是京味茶馆文化集萃地。
店内开设有京味茶文化产品服务体验售卖区、非遗体验中心，四合茶院、演出大厅，老北京传统商业博物馆、艺苑等场所。
开业至今，共接待83个国家近200位元首政要、众多社会名流和近千万中外宾客，被誉为展示民族文化精品的 “窗口”和联结中外人民友谊的“桥梁”，有着“北京城市名片”和“京味人文地标”的美誉。
“大碗茶二分钱一碗，茉莉飘香，香透了心呐！”这是老舍茶馆独有的吆喝声。就在茶馆正门的西侧，有一处“老二分”大碗茶茶摊，它就是老舍茶馆的前身——大碗茶青年茶社。
1979年，改革开放之初，老舍茶馆创始人尹盛喜带领20多名返城知青自主创业，在前门箭楼旁搭茶棚，靠卖两分钱一碗的大碗茶起家，既好喝，又解渴，直到现在老舍茶馆仍然保留着“老二分”大碗茶茶摊，卖的还是老北京人最爱喝的香片——茉莉花茶。接过蓝袍小二递来的“老二分”大碗茶，可以深刻感受到老北京的市井文化。
登上茶馆二楼，则是老北京传统商业博物馆，馆内藏有十三家用“面塑”捏制的老北京商铺微缩景观、五光十色的老北京招幌、百件老物件等。
置身于此，仿佛穿越回老北京的商街中，徜徉在旧时熙熙攘攘的大栅栏……
门店信息
电话：010-63036830
地址：前门西大街正阳市场3号楼
六必居（前门店）
六必居由山西省赵氏三兄弟创立，迄今已有近六百年的历史，是北京中轴线上历史最为悠久的中华老字号之一，“六必居酱菜制作技艺”已被列入国家级非物质文化遗产保护名录。
六必居酱菜的传统制作技艺一直以口耳相授的方式世代传承。其首先注重选料品质，如黄瓜须“顶花带刺”，芥菜头须是有“两道门”的均匀个，黄豆均选自河北丰润县（今唐山市丰润区）和通州永乐店。
在制作工艺上，从黄豆的发酵、碾碎到酱料的起缸，每一步都要严格遵循传统方法，如黄豆需经21天发酵，保证酱料的醇厚。在操作规程上，六必居酱菜的制作遵循“六必”祖训，“秫稻必齐、曲蘖必时、湛炽必洁、水泉必香、陶器必良、火齐必得”，确保酱菜的品质。
六必居名字背后也有着必须坚守的“六必”祖训，其中的“曲蘖必时”说的是制作酱菜必须遵从时令和节气的安排。六必居酱菜素以酱香浓郁、鲜甜脆嫩而著称，清代以来的文人笔记中对此多有称誉。
坐落在前门大栅栏粮食店街的六必居博物馆，与六必居老店紧挨着。这是一座以酱菜文化为主题的特色博物馆，承载着近500年的商业传奇，堪称中国食品行业的"活化石"。
博物馆分为三层，从“食肴之将”“源远流长”“涅槃重生”“与时俱进”四个单元讲述六必居故事，更“藏”着六必居数百年来的账册、照片、功牌、印章、房契、算盘、油灯、酒壶、牌匾及生产制作工器具等近百件难得一见的藏品……
今年，在“文化和自然遗产日”及北京中轴线申遗成功一周年之际，六必居博物馆入选首批“中轴线非遗之旅合作空间”。
门店信息
电话：010-63035109
地址：粮食店街3号
张一元（总店）
张一元始建于清光绪二十六年(1900年)，店名取自“一元复始 万象更新”之意，是商务部认定的中华老字号企业。在花茶领域，张一元茉莉花茶制作技艺首家（2008年）被列入国家级非物质文化遗产代表性项目名录，2022年被列入联合国教科文组织人类非物质文化遗产代表作名录。
历经百年，张一元在全国名茶产区已建立31个生产基地，生产加工绿、红、白、青（乌龙茶）、黑茶等茶类逾400多种，其中茉莉花茶以“汤清味浓、入口芳香、回味无穷”的特点享誉海内外。
张一元总店于1908年建立，1952年与观音寺店合并为总店，2012年被授予“中国茶业首家亿元店”荣誉称号，连续14年单店销售额突破亿元，2024年单店年销售跨越3.5亿元。代表产品“龙毫”茉莉花茶连续7年单品年销售突破亿元，2024年单品年销售额实现3.5亿元。
店内楼梯每一级台阶上都书写着张一元与茶客们共同创造的新纪录，也时刻准备承载新的篇章。
门店信息
电话：010-63010553
地址：大栅栏街22号
护国寺小吃（护国寺总店）
说到北京特色小吃，那就不得不提到护国寺小吃了。
护国寺小吃的源头来自于老北京的护国寺庙会。据史料记载，清代护国寺庙会极为兴盛，每月初七、初八都有庙会，京城内有名的小吃摊都汇聚于此。摊主们搭上布棚，摆出字号，搭好桌凳，就在一旁支起炉火，开始了叫卖，年糕、灌肠、爆肚、茶汤等食品一应俱全，来此烧香、游玩的顾客逛累了就会在摊位前大快朵颐起来。
1950年，护国寺庙会停办，曾经熙来攘往的护国寺街也逐渐冷清。直到1956年公私合营后，政府将一些小吃摊位集中，并成立了护国寺小吃店。
经过几十年的发展，目前护国寺有百余种小吃，种类繁多、口味丰富，深得京城老百姓的喜爱。
在护国寺小吃店里，老北京会点上一碗豆汁儿或者面茶，配上一份焦圈，作为新的一天的开始。奶油炸糕、糖耳朵、糖火烧……每一样都可以化作舌尖的甜蜜，在你心中烙印下属于北京的记忆。
护国寺小吃的魅力还在于，它既是早餐店，也是下午茶店。要是在下午路过护国寺小吃，不要忘记进来坐一会，点个杏仁豆腐或者豆汁儿冰淇淋，解锁一份“老北京限定下午茶”。
门店信息
电话：010-66181705
地址：护国寺大街93号
牛街清真满恒記（平安里西大街店）
牛街位于西城区，全程步行距离大约1公里，除了满街的新鲜牛羊肉，还散布着十几家售卖清真小吃的老字号。除了美食，附近还有人少好逛的西砖胡同、法源寺、烂缦胡同等好去处，无论是来北京旅游，还是休闲打卡，来牛街就对了！
在《2025北京米其林指南》米其林必比登推介中，西城区有6家餐饮店入选。其中，牛街清真满恒記（平安里西大街店）就是唯一一家京味餐厅。
北京特色炭火铜锅涮羊肉，北京清真风味名小吃。在北京，怎么可以不品尝京城铜锅涮肉？
作为公认北京铜锅涮肉的“天花板”之一、外地游客抵京必打卡的美食胜地，满恒记始终坚持严格的清真食品标准，对食材精挑细选，在传承经典清真风味的同时不断推陈出新。
菜品新鲜，锅底咸淡适中，火候掌控炉火纯青。服务热情周到，上菜效率极高。手切鲜羊羔肉入锅轻涮，裹满浓香麻酱入口，鲜嫩多汁。金奖麻酱糖饼、脆骨羊肉、一口酥烧饼等招牌，同样令人回味无穷。
门店信息
电话：010-66517188，010-66126825
地址：平安里西大街14号（赵登禹路口西南角）

author: Marta A. Aznar
title: Los municipios de la Región de Murcia que alcanzaron hasta 44 grados este jueves | La Verdad
text: Secciones Servicios Destacamos Marta A. Aznar Viernes, 2 de agosto 2024, 14:01 Necesitas ser suscriptor para acceder a esta funcionalidad. Opciones para compartir Las jornadas de calor de los últimos días activaron la alerta naranja en la Región de Murcia y, aunque es cierto que la Agencia Estatal de Meteorología (Aemet) prevé una ligera bajada de temperaturas para este viernes y de cara al fin de semana, los termómetros del jueves llegaron a superar los 44 grados en algunos puntos del Valle del Guadalentín. De este modo, la Aemet confirma que las temperaturas registradas en algunos municipios de la Comunidad se han situado entre las más elevadas de toda España. Según los datos, las máximas de la Región se alcanzaron en las ciudades de Totana, Lorca y Alhama de Murcia, siendo esta última la más afectada por el calor, superando los 44 grados en las primeras horas de la tarde. Lorca la siguió de cerca rozando los 43 grados, al igual que Totana, donde los termómetros llegaron a marcar 42 grados y medio a las 15.00 horas. También el Altiplano compartió las temperaturas más calurosas de este jueves, llegando a sobrepasar, tanto Jumilla como Yecla, los 42 grados. Noticia relacionada Mientras tanto, a pesar de la sensación térmica, la capital murciana no pasó de los 38 grados de máxima, dando un respiro a los ciudadanos que habían sufrido, semanas atrás, temperaturas de hasta 44 grados provocadas por la pasada ola de calor. Por otro lado, la costa de la Región registró temperaturas que casi alcanzaron los 36 grados en ciudades como Águilas, pero que no superaron los 33 de máxima en la mayor parte del Mar Menor y el Campo de Cartagena, sin llegar a los 32 grados en munucipios como San Javier. Con respecto a las mínimas, Alhama de Murcia volvió a encabezar la lista, rozando apenas los 21 grados durante las últimas horas de la madrugada, 23 grados menos que los que alcanzó pasadas las 16.00 horas. Jumilla, Caravaca de la Cruz y Abanilla registraron temperaturas parecidas, que no llegaron a superar los 23 grados. Mínimas que, por su parte, equivalen a las máximas que comunidades autónomas como Asturias experimentaron la pasada jornada. - Alhama de Murcia: 44.1 - Lorca: 44.9 - Lorca, Zarcilla de Ramos: 42.8 - Totana: 42.5 - Yecla: 42.3 - Jumilla: 42.2 - Puerto Lumbreras: 41.9 - Caravaca de la Cruz: 41.8 - Calasparra: 41.3 - Caravaca de La Cruz, Los Royos: 40.7 - Cieza: 40.5 - Mula: 39.8 - Bullas: 39.4 - Archena: 39.3 - Fuente Álamo: 38.4 - Molina de Segura: 38.3 - Benizar: 38.1 - Murcia: 37.5 - Abanilla: 35.8 - Torre Pacheco: 35.8 - Águilas: 35.7 - Cartagena, Tentegorra: 34.4 - Mazarrón: 33.8 - Cartagena, Cabo de Palos: 33 - Cartagena: 32.3 - San Javier: 31.7 Publicidad Publicidad Publicidad Te puede interesar [ Pillado escondido en el rellano cuando intentaba robar en un bloque de pisos ](https://www.elnortedecastilla.es/valladolid/pillado-escondido-rellano-intentaba-robar-bloque-pisos-20240801114708-nt.html#vca=voc-recirc&vso=laverdad) El Norte de Castilla Publicidad Publicidad Especiales [ Así se desbocó el urbanismo en La Manga ](/murcia/desboco-urbanismo-manga-20230827074517-nt.html) Fernando López Hernández Comentar es una ventaja exclusiva para suscriptores ¿Ya eres suscriptor? Necesitas ser suscriptor para poder votar. Reporta un error en esta noticia

author: GMA News
title: LA Tenorio and his devotion to St. Padre Pio
text:
LA Tenorio and his devotion to St. Padre Pio
Basketball star LA Tenorio is a devotee of St. Padre Pio.
St. Padre Pio was an Italian monk who was known for his stigmata or the wounds which were similar to Jesus Christ's wounds in His crucifixion. Many claim that devotion to Padre Pio would lead to curing sicknesses.
In an episode of Biyahe ni Drew, the Barangay Ginebra star shared that he became a devotee of St. Padre Pio even before he was
diagnosed with colon cancer in 2022.
"Before I was diagnosed na may cancer, pumupunta na ako rito kay Padre Pio," Tenorio shared.
"Ang laking pagbabago ng perspective in life. Number one, it really strengthened my faith."
(Before I was diagnosed with cancer, I already came to Padre Pio. I had a different perspective in life. Number one, it strengthened my faith.)
His parents influenced him to be a devotee and while undergoing treatment for his cancer, Tenorio had relics and religious articles with Padre Pio's image.
"Nung nagkasakit ako, karamihan ng mga kaibigan, kamag-anak, puro Padre Pio relic ang binibigay sa akin. Alam nila na nakakapagpagaling talaga si Padre Pio ng mga may sakit, lalo na ng malalang sakit."
(When I was diagnosed, many of my friends and relatives gave me Padre Pio relics. They know that Padre Pio cures even extreme sickness.)
Eventually,
Tenorio became cancer-free and returned to basketball with a bigger purpose.
"We tend to take things for granted. 'Di natin nare-realize how important they are in our lives. Binigyan ako ng pagkakataon ulit ng ating Panginoon na higher purpose. It's higher than basketball already."
(We tend to take things for granted. We do not realize how important they are in our lives. I was given a chance by God to have a higher purpose. It's higher than basketball already.)
—JKC, GMA Integrated News

author: Megan Mertz
title: Church Worker Retreats
text:
National
Church Worker Retreats
The LCMS Office of National Mission has held retreats around the country to care for the Synod’s ordained and commissioned ministers.
Church worker wellness has long been a mission priority in The Lutheran Church—Missouri Synod (LCMS). Church workers who are healthy in mind, body and spirit are better able to care for their congregations and their families, and they tend to stay in ministry longer and suffer less burnout.
But the resilience of many of the Synod’s church workers was severely tested by the disruptions and uncertainties caused by the COVID-19 pandemic. As pandemic restrictions stretched on, many church workers reported feeling weary, discouraged and anxious.
“Generally, we can handle this kind of stress for short periods of time, but it doesn’t take long for the adrenaline to wear off and for fatigue to set in,” said the Rev. Michael Meyer, managing director of Congregations and Districts for the LCMS Office of National Mission (ONM).
To care for weary workers, the ONM used donations generously given to LCMS World Relief and Human Care to hold two respite retreats in St. Louis during the summer of 2021. The ONM also partnered with DOXOLOGY: The Lutheran Center for Spiritual Care and Counsel, an LCMS Recognized Service Organization, to offer “Take Heart” retreats around the country for ordained and commissioned ministers. The retreats were free and offered the opportunity for respite, reflection and spiritual refreshment. As of the end of 2023, a total of 38 retreats were offered in conjunction with DOXOLOGY.
“God renewed my heart when it was downcast. DOXOLOGY opened me up to once again taste the goodness of the Lord and hope in Him,” said a pastor who attended one of the first respite retreats.
Three more “Take Heart” retreats will be held in August 2024 in the LCMS Northern Illinois District, Iowa District West and Iowa District East.
Learn More

Upcoming Retreats Offer Pastors Respite from Pandemic

author: @Mariana Baabar,Muhammad Anis
title: Relief as Pakistan, Iran agree to ‘de-escalate’ after tit-for-tat airstrikes
text: ISLAMABAD: After the National Security Committee (NSC) meeting, Caretaker Prime Minister Anwaar-ul-Haq Kakar chaired the federal cabinet meeting on Friday and said it was in the interest of Pakistan and Iran to take steps to restore the relationship to what it was prior to January 16. He said Pakistan would welcome and reciprocate all positive measures from the Iranian side in this regard. The Ministry of Foreign Affairs briefed the caretaker federal cabinet about the situation arising from the Iranian attack on Pakistan, a the high professionalism with which the armed forces responded to the breach of Pakistan’s sovereignty and how the entire government machinery worked in unison in this regard. The cabinet also endorsed the decisions made at the NSC meeting earlier. Speaking at the cabinet, the PM affirmed that Pakistan was a law-abiding and peace-loving country and it sought friendly and cooperative relations with all the countries, particularly its neighbours. He said Pakistan and Iran were two brotherly countries that had historically enjoyed fraternal and cooperative relations, marked by respect and affection. The NSC, which met with Caretaker PM Anwaar-ul-Haq Kakar in the chair, noted that Iran is a neighbourly and brotherly Muslim country, and existing multiple communication channels between the two countries should be utilised to address each other’s security concerns in the larger interest of regional peace and stability. The forum undertook a wholesome review of the situation and lauded the professional, calibrated and proportionate response by the armed forces of Pakistan against unprovoked and unlawful violation of Pakistan’s sovereignty by Iran on Tuesday. The NSC, however, reiterated the unflinching resolve that sovereignty and territorial integrity of Pakistan are absolutely inviolable and sacrosanct and any attempt by anyone to breach it on any pretext would be responded with full might of the state. The meeting reaffirmed that the security and safety of the people of Pakistan is of paramount importance and no stone would be left unturned to ensure it. The PM had shortened his visit of Davos where he was attending the World Economic Forum, to chair emergency meetings of the federal cabinet and NSC in Islamabad in the wake of tensions at the Pak-Iran border. Caretaker ministers for Defence, Foreign Affairs, Finance and Information, Chairman of Joint Chiefs of Staff Committee, Chief of the Army Staff, Chief of Naval Staff and Chief of Air Staff as well as heads of intelligence agencies attended the meeting. During the meeting, participants were briefed about political and diplomatic developments bearing upon the prevailing situation between Pakistan and Iran and its impact on the overall security milieu in the region. The forum also took stock of the ‘Operation Marg Bar Sarmachar’, which was successfully executed against Pakistani originated Baloch terrorists residing on the ungoverned spaces inside Iran. An update on the situation along the borders and necessary full preparations done to comprehensively respond to any further violation of national sovereignty was also deliberated. The meeting impressed upon Pakistan’s commitment to sovereignty and territorial integrity of all countries in accordance with the UN charter and international norms. The committee also reiterated the resolve to deal with the menace of terrorism, in all its forms and manifestations, with an iron hand. The forum also highlighted that Pakistan has suffered far more than any other country due to the scourge of terrorism. The meeting also concluded that in line with the universal principles, governing the conduct of good neighbourly relations, the two countries would mutually be able to overcome minor irritants through dialogue and diplomacy and pave the way to further deepen their historic relations. Earlier, the ice started melting between Pakistan and Iran on Thursday night with both sides reaching out to each other in the aftermath of deadly airstrikes in each other’s countries. Pakistan made it abundantly clear that Iran had to respect its territorial sovereignty as it did not want to “further exacerbate” the delicate situation. Ambassadors of both countries are also expected to return to their posts soon. In this regard, senior Pakistani and Iranian diplomats reached out to each other on Friday morning, with China, Turkiye, Russia and the United Nations calling for restraint and working behind the scenes. ‘Twitter diplomacy’ was also in play where senior diplomats from both countries reached out to each other while offering an olive branch with the consent of their bosses. This culminated late Friday evening with a telephone call between Foreign Minister Jalil Abbas Jilani and his Iranian counterpart Hossein Amir-Abdollahian, in which Pakistan said it was ready to offer closer cooperation on security issues and both ministers also talked about the return of ambassadors of the two countries to their respective capitals. “Underscoring the close brotherly relations between Pakistan and Iran, the foreign minister expressed Pakistan’s desire to work with Iran based on spirit of mutual trust and cooperation. He also stressed that respect for territorial integrity and sovereignty must underpin this cooperation,” said the Foreign Office. The two foreign ministers agreed that working-level cooperation and close coordination on counterterrorism and other aspects of mutual concern should be strengthened. They also agreed to de-escalate the situation. “Foreign Minister Jilani expressed Pakistan’s readiness to work with Iran on all issues based on spirit of mutual trust and cooperation. He underscored the need for closer cooperation on security issues,” said the Foreign Office in its statement. These engagements at different diplomatic levels came as Pakistan showed to the world that it would not remain silent and should not be taken for granted if anyone tried to damage its territorial sovereignty. Before Pakistan struck back on Thursday, it had publicly told Iran that Pakistan reserved the right to respond to the provocative act, and it did. When Iran carried out a missile attack inside Balochistan, it did not take Pakistan long to strike back on Thursday at “hideouts used by terrorist organisations namely Balochistan Liberation Army (BLA) and Balochistan Liberation Front (BLF)” in Iran’s Sistan-Baluchestan province, in an intelligence-based operation codenamed ‘Marg Bar Sarmachar’. Earlier, when Iran had brazenly attacked Pakistan, Iranian Foreign Minister Hossein Amir Abdollahian had telephoned his Pakistani counterpart, who was in Kenya at that time. Jalil Abbas firmly underscored that the attack conducted by Iran inside Pakistani territory on January 16, 2024, was not only a serious breach of Pakistan’s sovereignty but also an egregious violation of international law and the spirit of bilateral relations between Pakistan and Iran. Expressing Pakistan’s unreserved condemnation of the attack, the caretaker foreign minister added that the incident had caused serious damage to bilateral ties between Pakistan and Iran. He added that Pakistan reserved the right to respond to the provocative act. “Stressing that terrorism was a common threat to the region and required concerted and coordinated efforts to combat this menace, Jalil Abbas underlined that unilateral actions could seriously undermine regional peace and stability. No country in the region should tread this perilous path,” the Foreign Office had stated. Earlier, Turkish Foreign Minister Hakan Fidan called Foreign Minister Jilani to discuss the ongoing developments between Pakistan and Iran. “The foreign minister shared Pakistan’s perspective and the recent developments. He stated that Pakistan’s ‘Operation Marg Bar Sarmachar’ was aimed at terrorist camps inside Iran and that Pakistan has no interest or desire in escalation,” said the Foreign Office. Early Friday morning, Pakistan’s Ambassador Mudassir Tipu in Iran, who is presently in Islamabad, tweeted from his official account in which he highlighted Pakistan’s resolve to promote peace. “Pakistan has always stood by Iran through thick and thin. Cooperation and mutual trust between two brotherly countries, in a complex regional environment, is critical for peace & stability. Pakistan resolutely stands for its values to promote peace, stability and development,” he said. Meanwhile, Iranian Ambassador to Pakistan Reza Amiri Moghadam tweeted from his personal account pointing to the many times that Pakistan had supported Iran. “The two brotherly, friendly and neighbourly countries of Iran and Pakistan have always supported each other in different arena and hard times during the history. With common threats and interests, all-out potentialities and opportunities, the bilateral ties don’t tolerate any lag and delay,” he said. On Thursday night, a spokeswoman at the Foreign Office welcomed the Twitter exchange between senior diplomats of the two countries. When Iran had released a formal statement from its Foreign Office, Seyed Rasoul Mousavi, an Iranian diplomat on his ‘personal’ Twitter account from Tehran, tweeted: “I believe that the statement of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of our country is the end point on the waves of tension created between Iran and Pakistan. Leaders and high officials of both countries know that only terrorists and enemies of both countries benefit from the existing tension between the two neighbouring countries. “ Today, the main problem of the Islamic world is to stop the crimes of the Zionists in Gaza,” he said. From Pakistan’s Foreign Office, Ambassador Rahim Hyatt Qurieshi, Additional Foreign Secretary for Afghanistan and West Asia, and a former ambassador to Iran, tweeted from his official account, which meant he had been given the green signal at the highest level. “I reciprocate your sentiments, dear brother Rasoul Mousavi. Pakistan and Iran have fraternal relations and shall move forward to resolve all issues through positive dialogue. It is imp[ortant] to restore trust & confidence that has always defined our bil[ateral] rel[ations]. Our common challenges including terrorism require coordinated action,” was Hyatt’s suggestion. Saleh Zaafir adds: Pakistan’s Ambassador to Iran, Muhammad Muddasar Tipu, has briefed the top officials about the state of ties between Pakistan and Iran. He said the sentiments in Iran don’t support hostilities against Pakistan. Ambassador Tipu assumed his assignment in Iran’s capital in August last year. Sources maintained that Pakistan is in constant contact with the friendly capitals in the aftermath of January 17th aggression. The sources hinted that the visit of any senior diplomat from Tehran in immediate future couldn’t be ruled out. author: NewsBreak Original
title: The warmest December in Rockcastle County history
text: The popular image of an idyllic December is one of white Christmases, hot chocolate retreats, snow-capped conifers, and cozy, cold-weather activities. But not every December lives up to those expectations. Most of the continental U.S. will experience its peak winter cold weather in January and February . Officially, winter doesn't even start until Dec. 21. Across the U.S., the average December temperature from 1901-2000 was right above freezing point, at 32.68 F. Yearly temperatures can be compared to this 20th-century long-term average to find how uncommon a year's December climate was. The nation's warmest December on record was 2021, when the average temperature reached 6.66 F above the long-term average, at 39.34 F. December 2022 was closer to the previous century's average for the U.S. overall, at 33.08 F. The average temperature in Rockcastle County, Kentucky from 1901-2000 was 36.3. The diverse climates of the U.S. mean residents can experience a range of holiday weather without breaking out their passports. Within the continental U.S., Monroe County, Florida, at the Southeast tip of the state, reported the highest average December temperature during the past century at 67.6 F. On the other end of the spectrum was Roseau County, Minnesota, bordering Canada, at 7.2 F. However, across both sides of the extremes, temperatures are warming. While that doesn't mean every December will be warmer than the last or the prior century's average, it does mean long-term temperature averages will continue to inch up the thermometer. When did Rockcastle County, Kentucky experience its warmest December? To find out, Stacker used data from the National Centers for Environmental Information to identify the 15 Decembers with the highest average temperature since 1895. Also included is how that year's temperature compared to the 1901-2000 average. Read on to see if you lived through the warmest December in Rockcastle County, Kentucky history.

author: Mahima Jain
title: KnowMerit Online Coding Certification Courses
text:
Welcome to the KnowMerit Online Coding Certification Courses Forum!
This forum is dedicated to fostering discussions, sharing experiences, and providing support for individuals enrolled in KnowMerit's online coding certification courses. Whether you're a coding enthusiast looking to kickstart your journey or a seasoned developer seeking advanced skills, this community is designed to be a valuable resource for all.
Forum Sections:
-
Introductions:
- Start by introducing yourself! Share your background, coding interests, and your experience with KnowMerit courses.
-
Course-specific Discussions:
- Engage in discussions related to specific coding courses offered by KnowMerit. Share insights, ask questions, and collaborate with others on course materials.
-
Technical Support:
- If you encounter technical issues or have questions about the course content, this section is for seeking and providing assistance. Let's help each other overcome challenges.
-
Success Stories:
- Share your achievements and success stories related to KnowMerit's coding courses. Inspire and motivate others with your coding journey.
-
General Coding Discussions:
- Discuss coding concepts, industry trends, and share helpful resources beyond the KnowMerit courses. Connect with others who share similar coding interests.
-
Collaboration Corner:
- Explore opportunities to collaborate with fellow learners. Form study groups, work on coding projects together, and enhance your learning through teamwork.
-
Feedback and Suggestions:
- Share your feedback on KnowMerit's courses. Discuss what worked well, offer constructive criticism, and suggest improvements to enhance the overall learning experience.
-
Coding Challenges:
- Participate in coding challenges and share your solutions. Challenge others to solve problems, fostering a spirit of friendly competition and skill development.
Guidelines for Participation:
-
Respectful Conduct:
- Keep discussions respectful and inclusive. Embrace diverse perspectives and foster a positive learning environment.
-
Relevance is Key:
- Ensure that your posts are relevant to KnowMerit's online coding courses. This helps maintain a focused and helpful discussion space.
-
Constructive Feedback:
- When providing feedback, focus on constructive and actionable suggestions. This helps contribute to the improvement of the learning experience.
-
Collaboration Mindset:
- Embrace a collaborative mindset. Seek opportunities to learn from others, share your knowledge, and grow together as a community.
-
Celebrate Achievements:
- Celebrate both small and big achievements within the community. Your successes can inspire and motivate others on their coding journey.
Join us in building a vibrant and supportive community around KnowMerit's online coding certification courses. Let's learn, share, and grow together!
Happy coding!
Visit us:
